transcript:
well!" thought Rost6v. 
After passing some Austrian troops he no- ticed that the next part of the line (the Guards) was already in action. 
"So much the better! I shall see it close," he thought. 
He was riding almost along the front line. A handful of men came galloping toward him. They were our Uhlans who with disordered ranks were returning from the attack. Rost6v got out of their way, involuntarily noticed that one of them was bleeding, and galloped on. 
"That is no business of mine,"
